alert.note: Alert for Lyon; Mineral (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 16 at 1:19PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT AND UPSTREAM DAM RELEASES REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by snowmelt in addition to upstream releases out of both Topaz and Bridgeport Reservoirs. * WHERE...A portion of western Nevada, including the following counties, Lyon and Mineral. * WHEN...Until 100 PM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...High flows along the Walker River near Yerington. Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas along the Walker River between Wabuska and Weber Reservoir. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 113 PM PDT, Recent snowmelt along with upstream dam releases will progress downstream over the next few days. High flows may continue beyond this weekend. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
